item.author: grounded@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Grounded | Solid Gold Studios)
item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: You Think Good Design is Expensive? | Michael Rickhoff
item.itunes:title: You Think Good Design is Expensive? | Michael Rickhoff
item.itunes:subtitle: Gardens work in four dimensions.
item.description:
If you've ever thought that getting a Garden Designer in is expensive, consider the cost of bad design. Gardens work in four dimensions, and Garden Designers, Garden Architects and Landscapers are the people perfectly placed to understand this design concept. Mel and Mike discuss the pros (and cons) of finding someone you can work with, and why the first money you should spend before buying plants is on a good concept plan.

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded
item.itunes:summary: If you've ever thought that getting a Garden Designer in is expensive, consider the cost of bad design. item.itunes:keywords: Michael Rickhoff, design, Grounded, Melanie Walker, Mel's Treasures, another Solid Gold Studios podcast, podcaststudios.co.za, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: All the Deliciousness that is Jane! | Jane Griffiths
item.itunes:subtitle: All the Deliciousness that is Jane! | Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff with Jane Griffiths (Author of Jane's Delicious Garden/Kitchen/Herbs/Urban Gardening and A-Z of vegetables)
item.description:
The well-known veggie garden girl has branched out into a range of fantastic skincare products, specifically created with the avid gardener in mind. Sore back from bending over your floral beauties? There's a muscle rub for that. Fingers and hands grubby and chafed from planting? There's a balm to soothe your frustrated fingers. Tired of getting bitten by the garden bugs - not the good variety? She's created a bug-off spray for that too! The perfect way to keep your body in the same great shape your mind is in after gardening, and the perfect gift for the special gardener in your life.

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded

item.itunes:keywords: Jane Griffiths, Veggie Garden, herbs, vegetables, skincare, natural, organic, delicious, Jane Griffiths, Mike Rickhoff, Grounded, Melanie Walker, Mel's Treasures, another Solid Gold Studios podcast, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Annual Flower Growing made easy | Peter Goodwin
item.itunes:subtitle: It's time for the stars of the November Garden to take centre stage
item.description:
Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff | Following on the disastrous decimation of Impatiens walleriana crops worldwide a couple of years ago, there's good news for the 'busy lizzie' fans - they're back and in good shape. We also discuss the differences between those and New Guinea Impatiens, and the SunPatiens. Anything you need to know on where to plant them, how to plant them and how to care for them is on the menu!

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded
item.itunes:summary: Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff | Following on the disastrous decimation of Impatiens walleriana crops worldwide a couple of years ago, there's good news for the 'busy lizzie' fans - they're back and in good shape. item.itunes:keywords: Peter Goodwin, Bedding plants, New Guinea impatiens, SunPatiens, begonia, shade garden, full sun, Busy Lizzie, annuals, perennials, Grounded, Melanie Walker, Mel's Treasures, another Solid Gold Studios podcast, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: What we put plants through before putting them in the garden! | Kathy Varney
item.itunes:subtitle: We find out more about the process of plant trialing and how plants make it to the consumer in retail garden centres.
item.description:
Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff | Who doesn’t love to walk through a retail garden center and ogle all of the new plants that have made it to market each year? Ever ask how and why certain varieties make it to market and others don’t. The process of trialing is how. Plant trialing is not only an integral part of the green industry but it’s important for the consumer. Testing plants in varying parts of the country allows the breeders to make better decisions about what will look good and grow in the landscape and also allows the growers to decide what works best for their business and their cultural practices. We take a 'walk' through the process and highlight the upcoming plant trials at Ball Straathof.

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded
item.itunes:summary: Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff | Who doesn’t love to walk through a retail garden center and ogle all of the new plants that have made it to market each year? item.itunes:keywords: Kathy Varney, plants, new varieties, trials, plant trials, Ball Straathof, gardening, flowers, Grounded, Melanie Walker, Mel's Treasures, another Solid Gold Studios podcast, podcaststudios.co.za, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Life Is A Garden - The November Files | Cary Goodwin
item.itunes:subtitle: Life is a Garden is the marketing arm of SANA, the South African Nursery Association. This is the place to find out what to do and when in your backyard.
item.description:
Melanie Walker & Michael Rickhoff | The main aim of Life is a Garden is to bring relevant, industry-endorsed information to interested gardeners across Southern Africa. November is a busy time in the garden, and we take a look at some of the plants and activities we should be taking in hand. The star of the veggie garden is beetroot, the trend is still to grow vertically, containers are coming back into vogue with smaller spaces being utilised, and brachyscome, yucca, plumbago and Inca lilies are the flowers creating loads of colour.

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded
item.itunes:summary: Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff | The main aim of Life is a Garden is to bring relevant, industry-endorsed information to interested gardeners across Southern Africa. item.itunes:keywords: Cary Goodwin, brachyscome, yucca, plumbago, Inca lilies, alstroemeria, vertical, container, beetroot, health, flowers, vegetables, Grounded, Melanie Walker, Mel's Treasures, another Solid Gold Studios podcast, podcaststudios.co.za, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Are You What You Eat? | Linda Galvad
item.itunes:subtitle: Are You What You Eat? | Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff with Linda Galvad (Founder Sought After Seedlings)
item.description:
Continuing with the theme, You are what You Eat, Linda Galvad explores the subject of heirloom seeds, what GMO foods mean for the person and the environment, and how to Grow Your Own to the best of your ability. Sought After Seedlings is South Africa's home of organic seeds and stockist of high quality authentic Italian Franchi Sementi seeds.

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded

item.itunes:keywords: Vegetables, Linda Galvad, Sought After Seedlings, Mike Rickhoff, Gardening, Grounded, Melanie Walker, Solid Gold Studios, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Making Organic a Lifestyle, not a Duty | Jenny Slabber and Maureen Madiseng
item.itunes:subtitle: Making Organic a Lifestyle, not a Duty | Melanie Walker with Jenny Slabber (Sales Manager) and Maureen Madiseng (horticulturalist) at Talborne Organics
item.description:
Going green doesn’t start with doing green acts - it starts with a shift in consciousness. And the first shift is making sure that what you put into your garden, your home grown veggies and yourself is as natural as can be. Talborne Organics offers healthy, safe and sustainable organic options that will perform to professional standards on all projects, whether for the Big Agri farmer, or the home gardener.

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded

item.itunes:author: Melanie Walker | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: The "Dagga" Debate | Quintin van Kerken
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Dagga" Debate | Melanie Walker and Michael Rickhoff with Quintin van Kerken (Chief Executive Clear Option on Cannabis)
item.description:
On this episode, Melanie and Mike Rickhoff (senior lecturer at Lifestyle college) chat to Quintin van Kerken, CEO of Clear Option on Cannabis, about what implications the recent rulings on Marijuana in SA have for people.

For more podcasts, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/grounded
